page.title: 16Bevere Green Farm
page.content: This mixed farm is owned by Mr and Mrs N B Gwillam who are helped by their three sons. There are about 100 acres of land. There is a 17th C Queen Anne House but this is not the main farmhouse. A 19th C farmhouse was replaced in 1983 by a modern house. They have 17 beef cattle, 10 ewes with 19 lambs, hens and a cockrel, 2 horses and a dog. Most of their work nvolves growing vegetables - runner beans, cabbages, peas, cauliflowers, potatoes and sugar beet. Recently hedgrows and fences have been removed to make one large field from several smaller ones. One filed - 28 acres in size - is knwon as Battle Field and is believed to have been the site of a Roman fortress. The Gwillam's have left one part of their land uncultivated to encourage the natural flora. Many have already returned.
